sen.j: 横江荘（よこえのしょう）は、平安時代～戦国時代 (日本)にかけて加賀国にあった荘園。
sen.e: Yokoe on Sho (Yokoe Manor) was a manor located in Kaga Province from the Heian period to the Warring States period.
Yokoe on Sho (Yokoe Manor) was a manor located in Kaga Province from the Heian period to the Warring States period.
Yokoe on Sho (Yokoe Manor) was a manor located in Kaga Province from the Heian period to the Sengoku period (period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 「戦国時代」の表記を統一リストに基づき修正

sen.e: It was the territory of Todai-ji Temple.
It was the territory of Todai-ji Temple.
It was the territory of Todai-ji Temple.
Ishikawa District, Kaga Province (Ishikawa Prefecture).
Ishikawa District, Kaga Province (Ishikawa Prefecture).
Ishikawa District, Kaga Province (Ishikawa Prefecture).

sen.j: 現在の石川県松任市横江町。
sen.e: Modern day Yokoe Town, Matto City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
Modern day Yokoe Town, Matto City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
Modern day Yokoe-machi, Matto City, Ishikawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 住所表記のため、Yokoe Town→Yokoe-machiとしました。

sen.e: 86-cho, 5-dan, 200-bu (15,002m²) as of the year 818.
86-cho, 5-dan, 200-bu (15,002m²) as of the year 818.
86-cho, 5-dan, 200-bu (approximately 858,512 square meters) as of the year 818.
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 8世紀末に桓武天皇が皇女の朝原内親王に授与した「親王賜田」の一つ。
sen.e: One of the estates (shinno shiden) granted to Imperial Princess Asahara by Emperor Kammu.
One of the estates (shinno shiden) granted to Imperial Princess Asahara by Emperor Kammu.
One of the estates ('shinno shiden') granted to Imperial Princess Asahara by Emperor Kanmu in the late eighth century.
sen.cmt: 「8世紀末」→訳漏れのため訳出対応しました。原文に合わせクォーテーション追加、Kammu→Kanmuに修正

sen.j: 朝原内親王→酒人内親王→東大寺→横江氏→天龍寺
sen.e: Imperial Princess Asahara > Imperial Princess Sakahito > Todai-ji Temple > Yokoe clan > Tenryu-ji Temple
Imperial Princess Asahara > Imperial Princess Sakahito > Todai-ji Temple > Yokoe clan > Tenryu-ji Temple
Imperial Princess Asahara > Imperial Princess Sakahito > Todai-ji Temple > Yokoe clan > Tenryu-ji Temple

sen.j: 昭和45年(1970年)、同荘園跡から平安時代初期の掘立柱建物跡が検出され、同47年（1972年）に国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: In 1970, hottate bashira (earthfast post) remains of a building dating from the first part of the Heian period were discovered at the site of Yokoe Manor and the area was nationally designated a historic site in 1972.

In 1970, hottate bashira (earthfast post) remains of a building dating from the first part of the Heian period were discovered at the site of Yokoe Manor and the area was nationally designated a historic site in 1972.

In 1970, hottate bashira (earthfast post) remains of a building dating from the first part of the Heian period were discovered at the site of Yokoe Manor and the area was nationally designated a historic site in 1972.

sen.j: 平成20年(2008年)、平安時代の回廊状大型区画施設遺構が発見され、石川郡庁があった可能性が出てきたという。
sen.e: In 2008, the remains of a large Heisei period corridor-like structure were discovered and the possibility emerged that it could have once been the Ishikawa District office building.
In 2008, the remains of a large Heisei period corridor-like structure were discovered and the possibility emerged that it could have once been the Ishikawa District office building.
In 2008, the remains of a large Heian period corridor-like structure were discovered and the possibility emerged that it could have once been the Ishikawa District office building.
